qas.question: What happened to Russia's subdivision of government?

answers.text: changed towards a generally autonomous model
in the aftermath of the Soviet Union

qas.question: Who was in charge when the reforms was going on?

plausible_answers.text: changed towards a generally autonomous model

qas.question: What happened to Prussia's subdivision of government?

plausible_answers.text: in the aftermath of the Soviet Union

qas.question: Who wasn't in charge when the reform was going on?
Who was in charge when the reforms was scrapped?
Who escalted some reforms from Yeltsin?

context: The post-Imperial nature of Russian subdivision of government <a0_0><b4_0>changed towards a generally autonomous model<b4_0/><a0_0/> which began with the establishment of the USSR (of which Russia was governed as part). It was liberalized <a1_0><b5_0>in the aftermath of the Soviet Union<b5_0/><a1_0/>, with the reforms under <a2_0><b6_0><b7_0>Boris Yeltsin<b7_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/> preserving much of the Soviet structure while applying increasingly liberal reforms to the governance of the constituent republics and subjects (while also coming into conflict with Chechen secessionist rebels during the Chechen War). Some of the reforms under Yeltsin were scaled back by <a3_0><b8_0>Vladimir Putin<b8_0/><a3_0/>.
